Body: Robin has 28 packages of gum and 13 packages of candy. There are 4 pieces in each package.
Question: How many pieces of gum does Robin have?

Body: Baker made 157 cakes and 169 pastries. If he sold 158 cakes and 147 pastries
Question: How many more cakes than pastries did baker sell?

Body: In a school there are 868 girls and the rest are boys. If there are 281 more girls than boys
Question: How many pupils are there in that school?

Body: David did 51 push-ups in gym class today. David did 49 more push-ups than Zachary.
Question: How many push-ups did Zachary and David do altogether?

Body: Winter is almost here and most animals are migrating to warmer countries. There were 87 bird families living near the mountain. If 7 bird families flew away for winter
Question: How many more bird families stayed behind than those that flew away for the winter?

Body: A school has 485 pupils. There are 232 girls and the rest are boys.
Question: How many boys are there in that school?

Body: Baker made 134 pastries and 11 cakes. If he sold 140 cakes and 92 pastries
Question: How many more pastries than cakes did baker make?

Body: Nell collects baseball cards. She had 528 cards while Jeff had 11 cards. She gave some of her cards to jeff and now has 252 cards left.
Question: How many cards did Nell give to Jeff?

Body: The school is planning a field trip. The school has 66 classrooms. There are 102 students in the school and 8 seats on each school bus. If 22 students do n't want to go for the trip
Question: How many buses are needed to take the trip?

Body: 4 people can ride the Ferris wheel in paradise park at the same time. If each seat on the Ferris wheel can hold 2 people
Question: How many seats does the Ferris wheel have?
